item.title: Python Data Science Handbook: Essential Tools for Working with Data
item.description: A review of the Python Data Science Handbook, which covers IPython, NumPy, pandas, Matplotlib and machine learning with Scikit-Learn, and was written by Jake VanderPlas.

item.title: David Beazley: The Fun of Reinvention (Screencast)
item.description: In his keynote from PyCon Israel 2017 Python expert David Beazley talks about the fun of reinventing things and using and abusing new features in Python 3.6.

item.title: Installing and Setting up Python on Shared Hosting
item.description: This tutorial outlines the steps of installing and setting up Python on a shared hosting platform and how to enable the creation of virtual environments.

item.title: Customizing Matplotlib's Plotting Styles
item.description: A tutorial on how to customize the look and feel of plots created with the Matplotlib library for Python.

item.title: Automating Browser Tasks without Distraction on Ubuntu
item.description: How to automate browser tasks on Ubuntu using Selenium from Python without displaying a browser window.

item.title: Pycon 2015: Beyond PEP 8 by Raymond Hettinger
item.description: This talk from PyCon 2015 by Raymond Hettinger is about how to leverage Python language features to writer better and more beautiful code.

item.title: Automatic Code Reviews by Carl Crowder
item.description: An interesting 20-min talk introducing some of the tools available to analyze and report on your Python code base.

item.title: Asset Management in Python by Robert Kluin and Beau Lyddon
item.description: This talk from PyCon 2013 by Robert Kluin and Beau Lyddon is about strategies for managing frontend assets like CSS and JavaScript files in Python.

item.title: Raymond Hettinger: Transforming code into Beautiful, Idiomatic Python
item.description: In this talk from PyCon 2013 Python core developer Raymond Hettinger provides a fast-paced overview of Python idioms that make your code faster and more beautiful.

item.title: Introducing b2tob3: Easier Migration to Bootstrap 3
item.description: b2tob3 is a command line tool to help migrate Web projects from bootstrap 2 to bootstrap 3 by performing a set of replacements that reflect bootstrap 3 class name changes.

item.title: Python Script to Delete Delicious Bookmarks
item.description: A Python script to delete all bookmarks from the Delicious bookmarking service for the authenticated user.

item.title: (Ab)using Pandas to Migrate Disqus Threads
item.description: A short tutorial on how to use the pandas Python toolkit to create a URL map for migrating Disqus comment threads.

item.title: Taking Web Page Screenshots with PhantomJS and Python
item.description: A brief tutorial on how to create screenshots with common browser resolutions and save them as PNG files using PhantomJS and Python.

item.title: Python Text Processing with NLTK 2.0 Cookbook
item.description: A review of the Python Text Processing with NLTK 2.0 Cookbook that covers text categorization, topic identification, stemming, lemmatization, tokenization, corpus creation and more.

item.title: Mining the Social Web
item.description: A review of the book Mining the Social Web about collecting, analyzing, and visualizing data from social networks like Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.
